definition: Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: Dolcetto roughly translates from Italian as the "little sweet one."
sentences.chinese: 那隻不過是意大利語“小甜甜”的意思。

sentences.english: I did not speak Italian, but I took the menu and began pointing to it.
sentences.chinese: 我也不會講意大利語，但我把菜單和開始指向它。

sentences.english: Speak Italian, the local French-speaking and German.
sentences.chinese: 講意大利語，個別地區講法語和德語。

sentences.english: Italian is her native language, but she speaks French fluently , too.
sentences.chinese: 意大利語是她的母語，但他的法語也很流利。

sentences.english: I speak good French and I have a working knowledge of Italian and Spanish.
sentences.chinese: 我不但法語說得好，而且還粗通意大利語和西班牙語。

sentences.english: Completely, I did all of my classes in Italian, all of my exams in Italian,
sentences.chinese: 我所有的課程和考試都是用意大利語進行的。

sentences.english: She made a call in voluble Italian and hung up with a grin.
sentences.chinese: 她用流利的意大利語打了個電話，掛機時裂嘴而笑。

sentences.english: And in Italian, the word "mancino" can also mean someone who is dishonest.
sentences.chinese: 而在意大利語中，“左”字還可拿來形容某人不誠實。

sentences.english: She's a swiss from the italian-speaking canton of ticino.
sentences.chinese: 她是瑞士人，從說意大利語的提契諾州來。

sentences.english: German and Italian language courses are held in Munich and Rome respectively.
sentences.chinese: 德語課和意大利語課分別在慕尼黑和羅馬開設。

sentences.english: German and Italian courses are held in Munich and Rome respectively.
sentences.chinese: 德語和意大利語課將分別在慕尼黑和羅馬開設。

sentences.english: In Italian, the word belladonna means "beautiful woman."
sentences.chinese: 在意大利語中，莨宕的意思是“漂亮女人”。

sentences.english: "Maybe it will be here next week?" I ask her in Italian.
sentences.chinese: “也許下禮拜會寄到這兒？”我用意大利語問她。

sentences.english: COBO is also known as "antelope' in Italian."
sentences.chinese: COBO在意大利語中意爲“羚羊”。

definition: Min dialects, spoken in Fujian Province, Taiwan etc
Hanyu Pinyin, the romanization system used in the PRC since the 1960s
Korean language (esp. in context of South Korea)
